> his grandchildren need more discipline.

Does he only express this to you? Or does he say it to

messages.subject: Re: I protest!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 01/22/2002 1:59:38 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... My partner works for a local Girl Scout council, and their old office was on the first
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 01/22/2002 1:59:38 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> Today the pro life ladies are marching in front of our county courthouse.
> In this conservative little town they're kind of preaching to the choir,
> but I suppose it makes them feel good.
>

My partner works for a local Girl Scout council, and their old office was on
the first floor of a building. They had a relatively large sign. On the third
floor of the building was a small clinic where abortions were performed
occasionally, with a very tiny, non-descript sign. So sometimes groups of
protestors would gather for a few hours, looking like they were protesting
the Girl Scouts doing abortions. (In fact, I do agree that Girl Scouts
should not be performing abortions, although it WOULD make for an interesting
badge.)

Kathryn Baptista


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: I protest!
messages.msgSnippet: Today the pro life ladies are marching in front of our county courthouse. In this conservative little town they re kind of preaching to the choir, but I
messages.messageBody:
Today the pro life ladies are marching in front of our county courthouse.
In this conservative little town they're kind of preaching to the choir,
but I suppose it makes them feel good.
To totally change the subject, I have a continuing dialog, e-mail, with
my brother about spanking. He's expressing his idea that his
grandchildren need more discipline. His words. By discipline he means
they should get a swat or a full blown spanking when they do something he
doesn't like.
I'm feeling a little ill over his latest correspondence and wondering if
I can ever reach him or if I should continue to try. I almost posted his
e-mail here to let you all read it, then decided I didn't want to be
responsible for all the disgust it would cause.
Have any of you ever seen someone like this have a change of heart? Is
it worth the energy?

Deb L
